content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  February 01 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has downgraded the Long-term Issuer  Default Rating (IDR) for Tiffany & Co. (Tiffany) to 'BBB+' from 'A-'.  The  Rating Outlook is Stable. A full list of ratings follows at the end of this  release. KEY RATING DRIVERS The downgrade reflects Fitch's changing expectations for Tiffany's medium term  EBITDA trends given signs of a luxury spending slowdown in the U.S. and other  key markets as well
name: Tiffany & Co
title: Fitch Downgrades Tiffany's IDR to 'BBB+'; Outlook Stable

content: May 27 Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co  reported a 5 percent fall in quarterly sales as a strong dollar discouraged tourists from spending in its U.S. stores and reduced the value of overseas sales.
name: Tiffany & Co
title: Strong dollar hits Tiffany's quarterly sales

content: Tiffany & Co's  quarterly sales fell for the first time in five years and are expected to decline further as a strong dollar not only keeps tourists away from its flagship New York jewelry store but also reduces the value of sales overseas. | Video
name: Tiffany & Co
title: Tiffany's sales fall for first time in 5 years on strong dollar

content: March 20 Tiffany & Co's quarterly sales fell for the first time in five years and are expected to decline further as a strong dollar not only keeps tourists away from its flagship New York jewelry store but also reduces the value of sales overseas.
name: Tiffany & Co
title: UPDATE 4-Tiffany's sales fall for first time in 5 years on strong dollar

content: March 20 Tiffany & Co's quarterly sales fell for the first time in five years and are expected to decline further as a strong dollar not only keeps tourists away from its flagship New York jewelry store but also reduces the value of sales overseas.
name: Tiffany & Co
title: REFILE-UPDATE 3-Tiffany's sales fall for first time in 5 years on strong dollar

content: ZURICH  March 4 Swiss watchmaker Swatch  said on Wednesday that an arbitration ruling in its case against U.S. jeweler Tiffany & Co from December 2013 was set aside by an Amsterdam court.
name: Tiffany & Co
title: Swatch Group says arbitration decision against Tiffany set aside

title: GLOBAL MARKETS-Slump in oil drives down equities around the world

content: Upscale jeweler Tiffany & Co  cut its profit forecast for the full year  citing a disappointing holiday shopping season and further weakness in Japan. | Video
name: Tiffany & Co
title: Tiffany cuts profit forecast as holiday shopping disappoints

content: Jan 12 Upscale jeweler Tiffany & Co cut its profit forecast for the full year  citing a disappointing holiday shopping season and further weakness in Japan.

title: UPDATE 2-Tiffany cuts profit forecast as holiday shopping disappoints
